title: 2.1 Functions and Evolutions of Human Resource Management

questionList.qu: What is Human Resource Management?
questionList.a1: the role of managers in planning and developing the organization's people
questionList.a2: the management process of forecasting an organizations current and future staffing needs
questionList.a3: hiring staff from outside of the organization
questionList.a4: formal process of evaluating employees performance
questionList.solution: HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT (HRM) = the role of managers in planning and developing the organization's people. HUMAN RESOURCE PLANNING = the management process of forecasting an organizations current and future staffing needs. EXTERNAL RECRUITMENT = hiring staff from outside of the organization. APPRAISAL = formal process of evaluating employees performance

questionList.qu: How do you calculate Labour Turnover?
questionList.a1: (total # of staff / # of staff leaving) x 100
questionList.a2: (# of staff leaving / total # of staff ) x 100
questionList.a3: (# of staff leaving x total # of staff ) x 100
questionList.a4: (total # of staff x # of staff leaving) x 100
questionList.solution: Labour Turnover = (# of staff leaving / total # of staff ) x 100

questionList.qu: What word defines: an extension of outsourcing that involves relocating business activities and processes abroad
questionList.solution: OFFSHORING = an extension of outsourcing that involves relocating business activities and processes abroad. It is possible to offshore work but not outsource it although the practice is fominated by offshore outsourcing.

questionList.qu: Which catagory of Fair Dismissal would committing theft come under?
questionList.solution: Gross Misconduct includes major misdemeanours such as : Theft, Fraud, endangering others, being drunk at work, crimes etc. Gross Misconduct usually leads to dismissal without warning

questionList.qu: Which catagory for Fair Dismissal would underperformance come under?
questionList.solution: Incompetence includes : underperformance, lack of ability, effectiveness, and usefulness

questionList.qu: Which catagory for Fair Dismissal would being late to work come under?
questionList.solution: Misconduct includes : Unacceptable behaviour (being late to work alot of the time ,harassment , rudeness to customers , or constant missed deadlines) They will usually get warnings before dismissal happens

questionList.qu: Which catagory for Fair Dismissal would an employee not actually having the correct qualifications for a job come under?
questionList.solution: Legal Requirements include : if employee does not have necessary skill/requirements for the job Ex: employee being dishonest abt qualifications

questionList.qu: Which of the four types of Appraisal would : appraisal evidence being used to inform employee of their work practices and how to improve them on a continual basis come under
questionList.solution: FORMATIVE APPRAISAL = a type of appraisal system that takes place ona contunual basis rather than at the end of the trading year, in orfer to allow workers to improve their performance and effectiveness.

questionList.qu: Which of the four types of Appraisal would : collecting evidence about the apraisees job from peers subordinates line managers and other parties like suppliers and customers come under?
questionList.solution: 360 - DEGREE APPRAISAL = type of appraisal system that provides feedback from a range of employees who work with or have interactions with the person being appraised.

questionList.qu: Which of the four types of Appraisal would : a written description of employee performance at work that summarizes personal performance and achievements during the year come under?
questionList.solution: SUMMATIVE APPRAISAL = a written description of employee performance at work that summarizes personal performance and achievements during the year EXAMPLE : a person coming in to a classroom to observe a teachers lesson

questionList.qu: Which of the four types of Appraisal would : employees rating/appraising themselves based on a certain criteria given
questionList.solution: SELF - APPRAISAL = type of appraisal system that involves an individual worker reflecting on an rating his or her own performance against the pre-agreed benchmark performance standards

questionList.qu: What is Outsourcing?
questionList.a1: the practice of using external providers for certain non-core business activities
questionList.a2: the reversal of offshore outsourcing ie. the transfer of business operations back to its country of origin
questionList.a3: training aimed at introducing new employees to the company and all of the policies and practices that go with it
questionList.solution: OUTSOURCING = the practice of using external providers for certain non-core business activities. These firms are able to carry out the outsourced work for less than the business owuld be able to. Ex: Nintendo outsources the production of their game consoles to Taiwans Foxconn

questionList.qu: What is Re-shoring?
questionList.a1: the practice of using external providers for certain non-core business activities
questionList.a2: the reversal of offshore outsourcing ie. the transfer of business operations back to its country of origin
questionList.a3: training aimed at introducing new employees to the company and all of the policies and practices that go with it
questionList.solution: the reversal of offshore outsourcing ie. the transfer of business operations back to its country of origin. This usually happens when it does not financially benefit the company to keep offshoring.

questionList.qu: What is Induction?
questionList.a1: the practice of using external providers for certain non-core business activities
questionList.a2: the reversal of offshore outsourcing ie. the transfer of business operations back to its country of origin
questionList.a3: training aimed at introducing new employees to the company and all of the policies and practices that go with it
questionList.solution: INDUCTION = training aimed at introducing new staff to the busienss to get them familiar with the policies, practices and culture of the organization.

questionList.qu: What is Job Evaluation
questionList.a1: the practice of using external providers for certain non-core business activities
questionList.a2: the reversal of offshore outsourcing ie. the transfer of business operations back to its country of origin
questionList.a3: training aimed at introducing new employees to the company and all of the policies and practices that go with it
questionList.solution: JOB EVALUATION = an assesment of a particular job in relation to other jobs in the organization so that the remuneration and other reqards and benefits can be determined in an objective, transparent and fair manner.

questionList.qu: What word defines : the extent to which workers are flexible enough to move to different locations.
questionList.solution: MOBILITY OF LABOUR = What word defines : the extent to which workers are flexible enough to move to different locations. (geographical mobility) and/or their flexibility in changing to different jobs (occupational mobility)

questionList.qu: what word defines : the practice of hiring people who already work for the firm to fill a position.
questionList.solution: INTERNAL RECRUITMENT = the practice of hiring people who already work for the firm to fill a position, rather tahn employing someone new to the organization. (saves time and finance)

questionList.qu: what word defines : involves hiring staff from outside organization
questionList.solution: EXTERNAL RECRUITMENT = involves hring staff from outside organization to fill vacant posts

questionList.qu: What is the opposite of labour turnover
questionList.solution: RETENTION = the opposite of labour turnover, as it measures the ability of a firm to keep its employees at the organization, per time period

questionList.qu: What is the process of sifting through applicatiobs to identify suitable candidates for a job?
questionList.solution: SHORTLISTING = the process of sifting through applicatiobs to identify suitable candidates for a job. It is the stage that precedes the interview in the recruitment process
